column4: jo_: I want to diff my copy of acpi-support which I finally got working, with an unchanged copy, so Ican document the changes I made for other users of this model laptop.

jo_: I did delete the /etc/default/acpi-support file.  But I can't choose to install the acpi-support package in synaptic as it is already installed.  I can't remove it, as there are a lot of dependencies on it.  I thought reinstall might work to install the configuration files again, but it doesn't seem to.
i think lspci will show it, not 100% though, i don't screw with wireless..
thats a handy trick. thank you
